reviewText: This was recorded in front of a live audience in 1989 and cleaned up for its 2016 Blu-Ray release.  There is some audience and stage noise at times.  The picture quality is great and shows off the restrained neoclassical set contrasting with sumptuous costumes. Musically, it is a delight from beginning to end.  Marilyn Horne, of course, but show-stopping singing from the whole cast.  The wry staging gives every performer a spotlight for both understated comic and melodramatic turns.  A treasure.
